image.altText: A Commonwealth Bank branch in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest bank is blacklisting fossil fuel companies that can't show genuine efforts to reduce emissions, putting pressure on other finance institutions to follow suit.

title.children: 'The writing's on the wall': Australia's largest mortgage lender sets the tone after ditching climate culprits

image.altText: Peter Dutton sits in a chair on the floor of parliament, separate from his colleagues.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader's capacity to conflate a range of hot button issues, half-truths and misleading assertions is only matched by the federal government's often flat-footed capacity to respond.

title.children: Peter Dutton's calls to ban refugees from Gaza have proved too much for some MPs

image.altText: Satellite image shows a new series of defensive trenches.

props.synopsis: Since Ukrainian troops staged a surprise cross-border attack into Russia's Kursk region early last week, Kyiv claims to now control more than 1,100 square kilometres of territory. This is how the incursion is tracking.

title.children: Maps and satellite images show Ukraine's gains as incursion grows in Russian territory

image.altText: A woman holding her toddler son's hand walk through a car parking garage that is about half empty.

props.synopsis: Urban planners say Australia has too much parking. But as car ownership grows, questions have surfaced as to whether we could ever build less.

title.children: Jennifer lives in the middle of Melbourne where parking is scarce â€” but there's plenty available in her garage

image.altText: a headshot of a man with grey hair and glasses smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Allegedly dodgy doctors teamed up with an LA dealer known as the "Ketamine Queen" and the Friends' star's personal assistant to use his addiction issues to "enrich themselves", US authorities say after charging five people following a wide-ranging investigation.Â

title.children: 'I wonder how much this moron will pay': Inside the ketamine ring that fuelled Matthew Perry's addiction

image.altText: Two greyhounds at an outdoor event.

props.synopsis: Queensland's embattled racing integrity commission is facing a secret probe from independent investigators, with former staff making allegations of bullying, sexual harassment, suspect hiring practices and excessive expenditure, the ABC has confirmed.

title.children: Racing integrity body sent retired greyhounds to blood harvesting lab

image.altText: Jayson Gillham takes a bow standing next to a piano while orchestra members behind him applause

props.synopsis: Australian band The Cat Empire joins musicians objecting to the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra's cancellation of a performance by a pianist who spoke about the conflict in Gaza.

title.children: The Cat Empire postpones shows as musicians vote no confidence in MSO

image.altText: Barcelona beach

props.synopsis: Barcelona draws millions of tourists every year, and while the city needs their cash, many residents have had enough and are taking action, arguing the influx of visitors is unsustainable.

title.children: Barcelona is dependent on tourists. Here's why many residents want them gone

image.altText: Greens Senator for WA Dorinda Cox in a black shirt that says stop killing women.

props.synopsis: Families of missing and murdered women had already told their traumas to coroners, magistrates, journalists and police officers. Was a procedural Senate inquiry â€” bound by time and budget constraints â€” ever going to be any different?

title.children: The loved ones of missing and murdered Aboriginal women dared to hope for change. How much longer can they wait for justice?

image.altText: A close-up of a man with grey hair wearing a dark suit and red tie.

props.synopsis: The UN is calling for a ceasefire in Gaza so it can launch a polio vaccination campaign following a confirmed case of the disease there.

title.children: UN calls for Israel-Gaza War ceasefire after child diagnosed with polio

image.altText: An older woman wearing a party hat celebrates in front of some colourful streamers

props.synopsis: The most controversial thing I could possibly suggest about ageing is that it has almost nothing to with physiology and absolutely everything to do with attitude.

title.children: Healthy ageing is almost entirely a matter of mindset â€” and I'm determined to keep mine positive

image.altText: Boys at school

props.synopsis: It's an industry that emerged from a parental ambition to provide the best education for one's kids. But there are concerns about the quality of tutoring services and child protection â€” and experts want greater regulation.

title.children: Families can spend upwards of $20,000 a year on tutoring. The benefit for students is unclear

image.altText: Two people watching the sunset in the Antarctic.

props.synopsis: Economists estimate there are up to 400,000 "super commuters" in Australia travelling extreme distances, including overseas, for dream jobs or high-paying work in locations like Alaska and Antarctica.

title.children: 'One day I can be in Kazakhstan, the next day in Korea': Meet Australia's 'mega commuters'

image.altText: An aerial shot of a city skyline in the distance, with houses and parklands in the foreground

props.synopsis: An increase in supply, a decrease in overseas migration and share housing could be the reason the rental market is at last beginning to slow.

title.children: Australia's red hot rental market is at last starting to cool

image.altText: Female athletes at the CrossFit Games taking as knee in tribute of the late Lazar Dukic

props.synopsis: Members of the Australian CrossFit community say they are reeling following the death of a competitor during an event at the CrossFit Games in the United States, with athletes starting to question the safety of the competition.Â

title.children: Is CrossFit pushing competitors too far? Australian athletes question competition safety following death at 2024 games

image.altText: A composite of two images of Orpheus, one from 2018 and one from 2024.

props.synopsis: In 2018, Orpheus Pledger was well on his way to stardom and success. Six years on, he has now been sentenced to jail.

title.children: Six years ago, his star was on the rise. Now, the tables have turned for Orpheus Pledger

image.altText: A police car and an emergency vehicle surround a crushed car

props.synopsis: Young woman driver found guilty on two charges but jurors, forced to leave the court house when a fire alarm went off, were unable to reach consensus on a third charge.

title.children: Jury dismissed after it was unable to reach final verdict on fatal crash charges

image.altText: A man stands with a young boy sitting on his shoulder, both giving the thumbs up sign, with a mountainous island behind them.

props.synopsis: Former rugby union Wallaby Adrian "Moose" Skeggs grew up playing in nature and going to school barefoot on remote Lord Howe Island. Here's why he has returned to his childhood home to raise his son.

title.children: You've heard of a sea change, but how about an island change and barefoot schooling?

image.altText: An excavator digging into the earth.

props.synopsis: A man's questions about his veteran father's service led him to a filled-in bomb crater in the Vietnamese countryside.

title.children: A 15-year search for answers unearths dozens of soldiers killed more than 50 years ago

image.altText: Samantha Jade with long blonde hair, her arms wrapped around her neck which has a necklace with the word LOVE on it

props.synopsis: Samantha Jade, who calls her new EP "a love letter to love", opens up about her husband and their shared love of music in a wideranging discussion.

title.children: Samantha Jade opens up about love, anxiety, her Indian heritage and portraying Kylie Minogue

image.altText: A close-up shot of a hand resting on an elderly woman's hands.

props.synopsis: Some moral frameworks teach us that lying is bad. But what if telling someone with dementia the truth could cause them trauma or other harms?

title.children: Is it OK to lie to someone with dementia?

image.altText: Balinese wearing traditional clothes dance during Balinese arts festival in Denpasar

props.synopsis: Did you know that the Dutch once traded the swampy island of Manhattan to the British for an island in Indonesia? Take this quiz to learn more about Indonesia, as the country celebrates its 79th Independence Day.

title.children: So you've been to Bali, but how much do you really know about Indonesia?

image.altText: Tony Armstrong holds up a silver Logie in front of a media award

props.synopsis: The red carpet has been rolled out, and social media is abuzz ahead of television's night of nights. Here's everything you need to know ahead of the Logie Awards ceremony.Â

title.children: Everything you need to know about this year's Logie Awards

image.altText: A car park full of cars in East Perth.

props.synopsis: It may look like just another car park, but this lot nestled in the heart of East Perth is the battleground for yet another bitter spat between Basil Zempilas and the WA Labor government.

title.children: Parents, children in crossfire in latest spat between Basil Zempilas and WA government

image.altText: Rebecca Talbot smiling with a dog on a couch with children around

props.synopsis: A $20 million donation from philanthropist Kay Van Norton Poche is helping to bring world-class cancer clinical trials to Australia.

title.children: 'One of Australia's most generous women' has donated $20 million towards cancer clinical trials

image.altText: A grey-scale image of a small crustacean.

props.synopsis: When a UK palaeontologist examined rocks collected from rural west England in the 1990s, he found something unexpected: a tiny fossil with a perfectly preserved penis.Â

title.children: 'It's very rare that you can gender fossils': How scientists discovered a 425-million-year-old penis

image.altText: Female paramedic in black glasses stands in front of an army helicopter

props.synopsis: On finding out that paramedic Sandra Tozer was driving the ambulance, a patient with a broken leg jumped out and refused to get back in until a man drove. It's an extreme example, but paramedics like Sandra put up with sexism every day.

title.children: Saving lives against a headwind of sexism, female paramedics put up with a lot

image.altText: Two men, one in a police uniform and the other former prime minister John Howard, pictured side by side in a composite image.

props.synopsis: John Howard has defended the legacy of the Northern Territory Emergency Response, a fortnight after NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy's historic Garma address acknowledged its harmful impacts.Â

title.children: Former PM John Howard defends NT Intervention after police commissioner apology speech

image.altText: Arborists search for signs of the shot-hole borer beetle in Perth's Hyde Park

props.synopsis: Chainsaws are being taken to trees across Perth to stop the spread of shot-hole borer, but scientists say more research is needed to determine if there is a better way to eradicate the pest before beetle activity ramps up come spring.

title.children: Authorities in race against time to stop tiny pest destroying tree canopy before spring â€˜explosive phase' begins

image.altText: Tonia sits next to a chimp who peers at her from its glass enclosure. She has blonde hair and wears a pink t-shirt.

props.synopsis: From your next exotic animal docuseries obsession to Jeff Goldblum as a god in KAOS, here are five series that are new, good and out this month.

title.children: The newest bizarre documentary from the makers of Tiger King is here â€” this time it's about chimps

image.altText: Aboriginal Opal Miner George Cooley cutting opal stone.

props.synopsis: Coober Pedy is renowned for its productive opal mines, but the history of Aboriginal miners â€” who have participated in the industry since at least 1915 â€” has not been widely acknowledged.

title.children: The 'very, very untold history' of Coober Pedy's Aboriginal opal miners

image.altText: Felicity Mainwaring and Geoff Heazlewood composite image.

props.synopsis: Eight years on since a devastating flood wrecked their lives, these residents of Tasmania's Latrobe say fighting for an insurance payout is "the last thing you need to struggle through" after losing so much.

title.children: Fighting for insurance the last thing these flood survivors want or need

image.altText: Penguins stand in front of a glacier.

props.synopsis: Australia's highest peak is not Mount Kosciuszko but a far-flung icy volcano where intrepid mountaineers put their lives on the line to summit.

title.children: Australia's highest mountain isn't where you might think it is. A new documentary captures the first summit
